intro.speaker: Luke
intro.line: Ahh... This forest sure is nice and peaceful.

intro.speaker: Luke
intro.line: Just walking around here makes me feel rejuvenated, in a way.

intro.speaker: Luke
intro.line: Oh, by the way. We're lost, aren't we?

intro.speaker: Luke
intro.line: Hey, Kris the Ordinary! Wasn't this supposed to be, y'know, a shortcut!? Well?!

intro.speaker: Kris
intro.line: Um... I'm sorry... I really did think it was... But we're definitely lost.

intro.speaker: Luke
intro.line: WHAAAAAT?! You don't need to tell me that! I figured that one out ages ago!

intro.speaker: Katarina
intro.line: Everyone, please, we mustn't fight. We need to work together in times of crisis...!

intro.speaker: Roderick
intro.line: She's right. There's no point in crying over spilt milk. Rather, let's find a way home. Ahem. Ladies and gentlemen, our new mission: find our way back to Altea Castle. Of course, we should try not to wander around aimlessly while we find our way.

intro.speaker: Luke
intro.line: Argh, we've totally fallen behind the others. ...Altean knights, lost in Altea. Sir Jagen is going to kill us...

intro.speaker: Katarina
intro.line: It's fine. If we march all night, we can make up for lost time. Ah...! Please, wait! Could that be...?

intro.speaker: Katarina
intro.line: Over there! That village is under attack!

intro.speaker: Bandit
intro.line: Gahahaha! Steal, burn, loot, pillage! Kill everyone who tries to flee! Gahahahaha!

intro.speaker: Legion
intro.line: Yes, yes, that's it, that's it. Uwee hee hee! ...The more you alls riot, the smoother our jobses will be! Uwee hee!!

intro.speaker: Kris
intro.line: Bandits, here...?! We can't just ignore this. Everyone, move out!

battle.speaker: Merric
battle.line: Bandits... Prince Marth would be saddened if he saw this...

battle.speaker: Kris
battle.line: Hey! Who are you? You don't look like you're in league with the bandits...

battle.speaker: Merric
battle.line: You've got [color] hair... I gather you're the commanding officer? Very well, I shall join you. The name's Merric. I'm a mage from Khadein. Your orders, please!

battle.speaker: Merric
battle.line: You've got blue hair... just like Marth's... I gather you're the commanding officer? Very well, I shall join you. The name's Merric. I'm a mage from Khadein. Your orders, please!

end.speaker: Merric
end.line: I'm glad everyone's safe. Might you be Altean knights?

end.speaker: Katarina
end.line: Hm, Kris, maybe this Merric is a friend of Prince Marth... That's it! He must be Merric the wind mage. I heard he even fought alongside Prince Marth during the War of Shadows. Wow, I-I'm a little nervous now...

end.speaker: Merric
end.line: Prince Marth summoned me to help train the new knights. But, sadly, I seem to be rather lost. Would it be alright if you would show me the way to Altea Castle?

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: T-to Altea Castle?

end.speaker: Legion
end.line: Uwee hee hee... Just as planned.

end.speaker: Clarisse
end.line: Legion.

end.speaker: Legion
end.line: Ooh, Clarisse. Didn't youses have somethings else to do?

end.speaker: Clarisse
end.line: Quiet, you. It was easier than taking candy from a baby. I don't waste my time like you lot. You and Reese had better end this quick! It's not hard.

end.speaker: Legion
end.line: Whatever. In the ends, our sneaking around is going to gets us results. We've gots a plan... We'll kills Marth... without fail.

end.speaker: Luke
end.line: Finally... Altea Castle. We're back at last.

end.speaker: Katarina
end.line: Huh? What's the matter, Kris? Is there something bothering you?

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Katarina, did you see him? Among the bandits... There was a funny man with a mask. I didn't count him amongst the dead. It's a little worrying...

end.speaker: Katarina
end.line: ...A masked man, huh? I'm sorry. I didn't see him... Well, it's okay. We did beat them in the end! Heehee, all this worrying's gotten me hungry... Come on, Kris, let's go and find something to eat.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: I'm just a little tired and hungry, is all.

end.speaker: Katarina
end.line: Ooh, is that all? To be honest, I'm a bit hungry as well... Kris, let's go and find something to eat.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Please, come in.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Commander Kris and Katarina, of the 7th Platoon, reporting as ordered, sire.

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Please, calm yourselves. You may stand at ease.

end.speaker: Katarina
end.line: Yet you summoned us so suddenly, milord... Is it to do with the bandits we subjugated? Are you, sire, reprimanding us for disobeying our orders?

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Not at all--it's quite the opposite. Your actions have saved many. As ruler, my duty is to protect my people, and I am truly grateful for what you did.

end.speaker: Katarina
end.line: We're honored to be of service, but that was tougher than any of our training. Phew...

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Kris, and you as well, Katarina... I hear from Jagen that you've been exemplary cadets.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Is that so, sire? Sir Jagen never intimated as much...

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: I've seen your skill, and I agree wholeheartedly with him. Why, the both of you are suitable for the Altean army. Should the two of you pass your test, I'd love it if you would become my Royal Guards.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: Royal Guards, sire?

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Though the stories tell of me as a great hero, it is not so. There is only so much that I can do by myself. That much, I know to be true. The War of Shadows was won with the aid of comrades who wished for the same future as I. 'Twas not a lone romp across the land. I realized, whether in peace or war, I need people I can trust--young, dynamic soldiers who can support and guide me.

end.speaker: Kris
end.line: B-but the Royal Guard exists to protect the king... It is a role of immense importance... Are we even fit for such an esteemed duty?

end.speaker: Marth
end.line: Yes, I believe so. I want you to be my Royal Guard. Jagen feels the same as I. But... don't feel obliged to promise me; I won't think ill of you if you decline. And so, I ask this of you once more. You need not answer right away. It's quite alright. Please think it over carefully.
